Post Content:
Dubai's 2040 Vision focuses on urban development and sustainability, the D33 Agenda is centered on economic growth and global competitiveness. Together, they form a holistic vision for Dubai's future. With questions about supply vs demand in the real estate market I thought it be useful to share key elements of the two.Scope and Focus:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: This is a comprehensive urban planning framework that focuses on the physical and spatial development of Dubai. It outlines strategies for land use, infrastructure, transportation, sustainability, and the allocation of resources to ensure balanced growth across the city. The plan emphasizes creating a sustainable, inclusive, and resilient urban environment.- D33 Strategy: This is an economic strategy aimed at boosting Dubai's global competitiveness and economic growth for the period 2023 - 2033. It focuses on key sectors such as trade, tourism, technology, and innovation, with the goal of doubling the size of Dubai's economy and solidifying its position as a leading global hub.Timeframe:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: As the name suggests, this plan looks ahead to 2040, providing a long-term vision for the city's urban development.- D33 Strategy: This strategy has a shorter-term horizon, targeting 2033, and is designed to accelerate economic growth and diversification within a decade.Key Objectives:1) Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040:- Enhance quality of life for residents and visitors.- Promote sustainable development and environmental conservation.- Optimize land use and infrastructure to accommodate population growth.- Develop vibrant communities and improve connectivity.2) D33 Strategy:- Double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033.- Strengthen Dubai's position as a global trade and tourism hub.- Foster innovation and attract foreign investment.- Create new economic opportunities and jobs.Implementation:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: Implemented through government agencies and urban planning authorities, focusing on zoning, infrastructure projects, and regulatory frameworks.- D33 Strategy: Driven by economic policies, public-private partnerships, and sector-specific initiatives to stimulate growth in targeted industries. ComplementarityThe two initiatives are interconnected. The Urban Master Plan 2040 provides the physical and infrastructural foundation needed to support the economic goals of the D33 Agenda. For example, improved transportation networks and sustainable urban development under the Master Plan will facilitate the economic activities envisioned in the D33 strategy.

*Eid al-Fitr; UAE announces holidays for public sector employees**Dubai:* The UAE government has announced that public sector workers will be granted three days of leave on the occasion of Eid al-Fitr. The Federal Authority for Government Human Resources has announced that employees will be granted paid leave in the first three days of the month of Shawwal. The exact start date of Shawwal is decided by the UAE’s Maspiravi Darshan Committee during the last days of Ramadan.Each month in the Hijri calendar lasts for 29 or 30 days. Since Ramadan started on March 1, Shawwal 1 will be on Sunday, March 30 or Monday, March 31.The Emirates Astronomical Society had previously said that Eid al-Fitr is likely to fall on March 31. If this is the case, employees will get a three-day public holiday. They will then have to return to work on Thursday, April 3.⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️ *Join the group for more news and updates from the expatriate world* 👇👇👇👇👇👇👇 https://lnkd.in/dix3up-h

However, financial institutions in the Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC) are exempt from this regulation.Under the new framework, companies must comply with federal and local laws, maintain separate financial records for mainland and free zone activities, and obtain additional permits if expanding beyond Dubai. The DET will issue and renew one-year licenses for businesses setting up branches in mainland Dubai and will soon release a list of permitted activities within six months.This initiative aligns with Dubai’s D33 agenda, which aims to double the city's economy to AED 32 trillion ($8.71 trillion) over the next decade, positioning Dubai among the top three global cities. The agenda also seeks to foster 30 unicorn startups, boost economic diversification, and strengthen Dubai’s status as a leading digital economy hub.With this resolution, Dubai reinforces its commitment to business-friendly policies, making it easier for companies to scale and thrive in one of the world’s fastest-growing economies.hashtag#freezonebusiness hashtag#businessexpansion hashtag#dubai hashtag#d33agenda

Free Zone Companies Can Now Operate Anywhere in the EmirateDubai has introduced a game-changing regulation that allows free zone companies to operate outside their designated zones, opening up new opportunities for business expansion and growth. Is Dubai Real Estate Market booming at a spectacular pace? 🏙️ They say it’s breaking record every month. With more investors looking to purchase the right property, how do you think one should choose?Here are few important tips that I usually share with my buyers while purchasing a residential property in Dubai:▪️ Investment Criteria:Firstly, make sure you’re aware of what your requirements, expectations and priorities are.For an investor this can either be rental returns or capital appreciation.But an end user might be looking for a better neighbourhood, conveyance to their workplace, schools etc.▪️ Price:Draft an exact idea about the amount of money you want to invest in a property. One must have enough liquidity to cover all the payment plans.▪️ Location:Finding the best location simply becomes on of the most important factors of a purchase. Buyers must be aware of infrastructure developments going to happen in the location where they are looking to purchase. They should analyze the current supply and demand of properties as well as create an estimate of the future supply inflows in that particular locality. An investor should be aware of the price per sqft of the properties in the locality and should have a better understanding of the appreciation value in the future by analyzing the infrastructure developments and government initiatives to happen in the future.For an end user conveyance to meet daily needs such as the distance from the office, school for their children etc., along with a neighbourhood that provides you a space of comfort and peaceful living could be the primary preference.▪️ Payment Plan:While selecting an off-plan property, the buyer should be aware of the payment plans provided by the developer.These payment plans are scheduled over the construction period and it should be convenient in accordance with the liquidity of the buyer. Different developers offer different sort of payment plans according to the project and their demand.▪️ Developer:Last but not least, the Developer’s profile is one of the most crucial aspects to consider while purchasing a property.The buyer should be aware of the track record of the developer such as the previous completed projects, construction timeline of the previous projects, quality of the buildings from previous projects, and whether they have an escrow account for the transfer of money.Given above are simply a few details one should consider before making an investment in real estate. There are definitely a lot other things to consider too, and this is where a property consultant comes into play.Share your thoughts!Looking to invest in this booming market? Contact me for expert guidance!

Some big news today!!​Dubai has introduced Executive Council Resolution No. (11) of 2025, issued by HH Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum , Crown Prince of Dubai and Chairman of The General Secretariat Of The Executive Council - Government of Dubai , to regulate the operations of free zone establishments wishing to operate outside their designated zones within the emirate. ​⁣⁣Key aspects of the resolution include:⁣⁣Licensing Requirements: Free zone companies seeking to operate in mainland Dubai must obtain the necessary licenses or permits from the Dubai Department of Economy and Tourism (DET). ​⁣⁣Compliance: Establishments are required to adhere to all applicable federal and local regulations related to their activities and maintain separate financial records for operations conducted outside the free zone. ​⁣DET's Authority: The DET is authorized to grant permissions for free zone establishments to operate in mainland Dubai by issuing licenses for establishing branches within the emirate or for branches headquartered in the free zone. These licenses are valid for one year and can be renewed. ​⁣⁣⁣This resolution aligns with the objectives of the Dubai Economic Agenda (D33),which aims to double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033 and solidify its status among the world's top three economic cities. ​⁣⁣⁣By facilitating the expansion of free zone businesses into mainland Dubai, the resolution seeks to enhance the emirate's business environment, promote economic activity, create jobs, and foster innovation, thereby reinforcing Dubai's position as a global hub for business, investment, and entrepreneurship. ​⁣Dubai getting more and more flexible !!

Username: Alexander O. P. BlomAlexander O. P. Blom
Post Content:
Dubai's 2040 Vision focuses on urban development and sustainability, the D33 Agenda is centered on economic growth and global competitiveness. Together, they form a holistic vision for Dubai's future. With questions about supply vs demand in the real estate market I thought it be useful to share key elements of the two.Scope and Focus:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: This is a comprehensive urban planning framework that focuses on the physical and spatial development of Dubai. It outlines strategies for land use, infrastructure, transportation, sustainability, and the allocation of resources to ensure balanced growth across the city. The plan emphasizes creating a sustainable, inclusive, and resilient urban environment.- D33 Strategy: This is an economic strategy aimed at boosting Dubai's global competitiveness and economic growth for the period 2023 - 2033. It focuses on key sectors such as trade, tourism, technology, and innovation, with the goal of doubling the size of Dubai's economy and solidifying its position as a leading global hub.Timeframe:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: As the name suggests, this plan looks ahead to 2040, providing a long-term vision for the city's urban development.- D33 Strategy: This strategy has a shorter-term horizon, targeting 2033, and is designed to accelerate economic growth and diversification within a decade.Key Objectives:1) Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040:- Enhance quality of life for residents and visitors.- Promote sustainable development and environmental conservation.- Optimize land use and infrastructure to accommodate population growth.- Develop vibrant communities and improve connectivity.2) D33 Strategy:- Double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033.- Strengthen Dubai's position as a global trade and tourism hub.- Foster innovation and attract foreign investment.- Create new economic opportunities and jobs.Implementation:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: Implemented through government agencies and urban planning authorities, focusing on zoning, infrastructure projects, and regulatory frameworks.- D33 Strategy: Driven by economic policies, public-private partnerships, and sector-specific initiatives to stimulate growth in targeted industries. ComplementarityThe two initiatives are interconnected. The Urban Master Plan 2040 provides the physical and infrastructural foundation needed to support the economic goals of the D33 Agenda. For example, improved transportation networks and sustainable urban development under the Master Plan will facilitate the economic activities envisioned in the D33 strategy.

*Eid al-Fitr; UAE announces holidays for public sector employees**Dubai:* The UAE government has announced that public sector workers will be granted three days of leave on the occasion of Eid al-Fitr. The Federal Authority for Government Human Resources has announced that employees will be granted paid leave in the first three days of the month of Shawwal. The exact start date of Shawwal is decided by the UAE’s Maspiravi Darshan Committee during the last days of Ramadan.Each month in the Hijri calendar lasts for 29 or 30 days. Since Ramadan started on March 1, Shawwal 1 will be on Sunday, March 30 or Monday, March 31.The Emirates Astronomical Society had previously said that Eid al-Fitr is likely to fall on March 31. If this is the case, employees will get a three-day public holiday. They will then have to return to work on Thursday, April 3.⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️ *Join the group for more news and updates from the expatriate world* 👇👇👇👇👇👇👇 https://lnkd.in/dix3up-h

𝐃𝐮𝐛𝐚𝐢 𝐈𝐬𝐬𝐮𝐞𝐬 𝐍𝐞𝐰 𝐑𝐞𝐬𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐨 𝐄𝐚𝐬𝐞 𝐅𝐫𝐞𝐞 𝐙𝐨𝐧𝐞 𝐁𝐮𝐬𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬𝐬 𝐄𝐱𝐩𝐚𝐧𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧Dubai has introduced a new resolution regulating free zone company operations, making it easier for businesses to expand within the emirate.Issued by Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Bin Rashid, Crown Prince of Dubai and Chairman of the Executive Council, the resolution allows free zone companies to operate in mainland Dubai, provided they obtain the necessary permits from the Dubai Department of Economy and Tourism (DET). However, financial institutions in the Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC) are exempt from this regulation.Under the new framework, companies must comply with federal and local laws, maintain separate financial records for mainland and free zone activities, and obtain additional permits if expanding beyond Dubai. The DET will issue and renew one-year licenses for businesses setting up branches in mainland Dubai and will soon release a list of permitted activities within six months.This initiative aligns with Dubai’s D33 agenda, which aims to double the city's economy to AED 32 trillion ($8.71 trillion) over the next decade, positioning Dubai among the top three global cities. The agenda also seeks to foster 30 unicorn startups, boost economic diversification, and strengthen Dubai’s status as a leading digital economy hub.With this resolution, Dubai reinforces its commitment to business-friendly policies, making it easier for companies to scale and thrive in one of the world’s fastest-growing economies.hashtag#freezonebusiness hashtag#businessexpansion hashtag#dubai hashtag#d33agenda

Free Zone Companies Can Now Operate Anywhere in the EmirateDubai has introduced a game-changing regulation that allows free zone companies to operate outside their designated zones, opening up new opportunities for business expansion and growth. This resolution was issued by Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed, Crown Prince of Dubai, Deputy Prime Minister, and Minister of Defence, in his role as Chairman of the Executive Council of Dubai. Key Highlights:✅ Expand Beyond Free Zones – Businesses can now serve clients across Dubai, not just within their designated areas. ✅ Regulatory Approval Required – Companies must obtain permits from Dubai’s Department of Economy and Tourism (DET) and comply with all applicable laws. ✅ Financial Transparency – Businesses need to keep separate financial records for operations outside their free zone. Why This Matters:This move makes it easier for businesses to expand, collaborate, and tap into new markets across Dubai, reinforcing the emirate’s reputation as a leading global business hub.What do you think? Is Dubai Real Estate Market booming at a spectacular pace? 🏙️ They say it’s breaking record every month. With more investors looking to purchase the right property, how do you think one should choose?Here are few important tips that I usually share with my buyers while purchasing a residential property in Dubai:▪️ Investment Criteria:Firstly, make sure you’re aware of what your requirements, expectations and priorities are.For an investor this can either be rental returns or capital appreciation.But an end user might be looking for a better neighbourhood, conveyance to their workplace, schools etc.▪️ Price:Draft an exact idea about the amount of money you want to invest in a property. One must have enough liquidity to cover all the payment plans.▪️ Location:Finding the best location simply becomes on of the most important factors of a purchase. Buyers must be aware of infrastructure developments going to happen in the location where they are looking to purchase. They should analyze the current supply and demand of properties as well as create an estimate of the future supply inflows in that particular locality. An investor should be aware of the price per sqft of the properties in the locality and should have a better understanding of the appreciation value in the future by analyzing the infrastructure developments and government initiatives to happen in the future.For an end user conveyance to meet daily needs such as the distance from the office, school for their children etc., along with a neighbourhood that provides you a space of comfort and peaceful living could be the primary preference.▪️ Payment Plan:While selecting an off-plan property, the buyer should be aware of the payment plans provided by the developer.These payment plans are scheduled over the construction period and it should be convenient in accordance with the liquidity of the buyer. Different developers offer different sort of payment plans according to the project and their demand.▪️ Developer:Last but not least, the Developer’s profile is one of the most crucial aspects to consider while purchasing a property.The buyer should be aware of the track record of the developer such as the previous completed projects, construction timeline of the previous projects, quality of the buildings from previous projects, and whether they have an escrow account for the transfer of money.Given above are simply a few details one should consider before making an investment in real estate. There are definitely a lot other things to consider too, and this is where a property consultant comes into play.Share your thoughts!Looking to invest in this booming market? Contact me for expert guidance!

Some big news today!!​Dubai has introduced Executive Council Resolution No. (11) of 2025, issued by HH Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum , Crown Prince of Dubai and Chairman of The General Secretariat Of The Executive Council - Government of Dubai , to regulate the operations of free zone establishments wishing to operate outside their designated zones within the emirate. ​⁣⁣Key aspects of the resolution include:⁣⁣Licensing Requirements: Free zone companies seeking to operate in mainland Dubai must obtain the necessary licenses or permits from the Dubai Department of Economy and Tourism (DET). ​⁣⁣Compliance: Establishments are required to adhere to all applicable federal and local regulations related to their activities and maintain separate financial records for operations conducted outside the free zone. ​⁣DET's Authority: The DET is authorized to grant permissions for free zone establishments to operate in mainland Dubai by issuing licenses for establishing branches within the emirate or for branches headquartered in the free zone. These licenses are valid for one year and can be renewed. ​⁣⁣⁣This resolution aligns with the objectives of the Dubai Economic Agenda (D33),which aims to double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033 and solidify its status among the world's top three economic cities. ​⁣⁣⁣By facilitating the expansion of free zone businesses into mainland Dubai, the resolution seeks to enhance the emirate's business environment, promote economic activity, create jobs, and foster innovation, thereby reinforcing Dubai's position as a global hub for business, investment, and entrepreneurship. ​⁣Dubai getting more and more flexible !!

Dubai's 2040 Vision focuses on urban development and sustainability, the D33 Agenda is centered on economic growth and global competitiveness. Together, they form a holistic vision for Dubai's future. With questions about supply vs demand in the real estate market I thought it be useful to share key elements of the two.Scope and Focus:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: This is a comprehensive urban planning framework that focuses on the physical and spatial development of Dubai. It outlines strategies for land use, infrastructure, transportation, sustainability, and the allocation of resources to ensure balanced growth across the city. The plan emphasizes creating a sustainable, inclusive, and resilient urban environment.- D33 Strategy: This is an economic strategy aimed at boosting Dubai's global competitiveness and economic growth for the period 2023 - 2033. It focuses on key sectors such as trade, tourism, technology, and innovation, with the goal of doubling the size of Dubai's economy and solidifying its position as a leading global hub.Timeframe:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: As the name suggests, this plan looks ahead to 2040, providing a long-term vision for the city's urban development.- D33 Strategy: This strategy has a shorter-term horizon, targeting 2033, and is designed to accelerate economic growth and diversification within a decade.Key Objectives:1) Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040:- Enhance quality of life for residents and visitors.- Promote sustainable development and environmental conservation.- Optimize land use and infrastructure to accommodate population growth.- Develop vibrant communities and improve connectivity.2) D33 Strategy:- Double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033.- Strengthen Dubai's position as a global trade and tourism hub.- Foster innovation and attract foreign investment.- Create new economic opportunities and jobs.Implementation:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: Implemented through government agencies and urban planning authorities, focusing on zoning, infrastructure projects, and regulatory frameworks.- D33 Strategy: Driven by economic policies, public-private partnerships, and sector-specific initiatives to stimulate growth in targeted industries. ComplementarityThe two initiatives are interconnected. The Urban Master Plan 2040 provides the physical and infrastructural foundation needed to support the economic goals of the D33 Agenda. For example, improved transportation networks and sustainable urban development under the Master Plan will facilitate the economic activities envisioned in the D33 strategy.

*Eid al-Fitr; UAE announces holidays for public sector employees**Dubai:* The UAE government has announced that public sector workers will be granted three days of leave on the occasion of Eid al-Fitr. The Federal Authority for Government Human Resources has announced that employees will be granted paid leave in the first three days of the month of Shawwal. The exact start date of Shawwal is decided by the UAE’s Maspiravi Darshan Committee during the last days of Ramadan.Each month in the Hijri calendar lasts for 29 or 30 days. Since Ramadan started on March 1, Shawwal 1 will be on Sunday, March 30 or Monday, March 31.The Emirates Astronomical Society had previously said that Eid al-Fitr is likely to fall on March 31. If this is the case, employees will get a three-day public holiday. They will then have to return to work on Thursday, April 3.⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️ *Join the group for more news and updates from the expatriate world* 👇👇👇👇👇👇👇 https://lnkd.in/dix3up-h

However, financial institutions in the Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC) are exempt from this regulation.Under the new framework, companies must comply with federal and local laws, maintain separate financial records for mainland and free zone activities, and obtain additional permits if expanding beyond Dubai. The DET will issue and renew one-year licenses for businesses setting up branches in mainland Dubai and will soon release a list of permitted activities within six months.This initiative aligns with Dubai’s D33 agenda, which aims to double the city's economy to AED 32 trillion ($8.71 trillion) over the next decade, positioning Dubai among the top three global cities. The agenda also seeks to foster 30 unicorn startups, boost economic diversification, and strengthen Dubai’s status as a leading digital economy hub.With this resolution, Dubai reinforces its commitment to business-friendly policies, making it easier for companies to scale and thrive in one of the world’s fastest-growing economies.hashtag#freezonebusiness hashtag#businessexpansion hashtag#dubai hashtag#d33agenda

Is Dubai Real Estate Market booming at a spectacular pace? 🏙️ They say it’s breaking record every month. With more investors looking to purchase the right property, how do you think one should choose?Here are few important tips that I usually share with my buyers while purchasing a residential property in Dubai:▪️ Investment Criteria:Firstly, make sure you’re aware of what your requirements, expectations and priorities are.For an investor this can either be rental returns or capital appreciation.But an end user might be looking for a better neighbourhood, conveyance to their workplace, schools etc.▪️ Price:Draft an exact idea about the amount of money you want to invest in a property. One must have enough liquidity to cover all the payment plans.▪️ Location:Finding the best location simply becomes on of the most important factors of a purchase. Buyers must be aware of infrastructure developments going to happen in the location where they are looking to purchase. They should analyze the current supply and demand of properties as well as create an estimate of the future supply inflows in that particular locality. An investor should be aware of the price per sqft of the properties in the locality and should have a better understanding of the appreciation value in the future by analyzing the infrastructure developments and government initiatives to happen in the future.For an end user conveyance to meet daily needs such as the distance from the office, school for their children etc., along with a neighbourhood that provides you a space of comfort and peaceful living could be the primary preference.▪️ Payment Plan:While selecting an off-plan property, the buyer should be aware of the payment plans provided by the developer.These payment plans are scheduled over the construction period and it should be convenient in accordance with the liquidity of the buyer. Different developers offer different sort of payment plans according to the project and their demand.▪️ Developer:Last but not least, the Developer’s profile is one of the most crucial aspects to consider while purchasing a property.The buyer should be aware of the track record of the developer such as the previous completed projects, construction timeline of the previous projects, quality of the buildings from previous projects, and whether they have an escrow account for the transfer of money.Given above are simply a few details one should consider before making an investment in real estate. There are definitely a lot other things to consider too, and this is where a property consultant comes into play.Share your thoughts!Looking to invest in this booming market? Contact me for expert guidance!

Some big news today!!​Dubai has introduced Executive Council Resolution No. (11) of 2025, issued by HH Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum , Crown Prince of Dubai and Chairman of The General Secretariat Of The Executive Council - Government of Dubai , to regulate the operations of free zone establishments wishing to operate outside their designated zones within the emirate. ​⁣⁣Key aspects of the resolution include:⁣⁣Licensing Requirements: Free zone companies seeking to operate in mainland Dubai must obtain the necessary licenses or permits from the Dubai Department of Economy and Tourism (DET). ​⁣⁣Compliance: Establishments are required to adhere to all applicable federal and local regulations related to their activities and maintain separate financial records for operations conducted outside the free zone. ​⁣DET's Authority: The DET is authorized to grant permissions for free zone establishments to operate in mainland Dubai by issuing licenses for establishing branches within the emirate or for branches headquartered in the free zone. These licenses are valid for one year and can be renewed. ​⁣⁣⁣This resolution aligns with the objectives of the Dubai Economic Agenda (D33),which aims to double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033 and solidify its status among the world's top three economic cities. ​⁣⁣⁣By facilitating the expansion of free zone businesses into mainland Dubai, the resolution seeks to enhance the emirate's business environment, promote economic activity, create jobs, and foster innovation, thereby reinforcing Dubai's position as a global hub for business, investment, and entrepreneurship. ​⁣Dubai getting more and more flexible !!

UAE's Fund Industry Transformation: How Feeder Funds Are Democratizing Private Market AccessThe UAE's fund industry is undergoing a profound transformation, driven by strategic regulatory reforms that are fundamentally reshaping how funds are structured, managed, and distributed to investors across the region.The DIFC and ADGM have emerged as essential facilitators in this evolution, fostering innovative investment solutions that align with the UAE's strategic vision of becoming a global financial hub.Global asset managers are responding through strategic partnerships with UAE-based entities, with companies like Standard Chartered, Franklin Templeton, BlackRock, and Aditum Investment Management pioneering feeder fund structures that maintain market access while ensuring regulatory compliance. Franklin Templeton's Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC)-domiciled fund ranges exemplify this approach, offering retail investors exposure to diverse asset classes through locally compliant vehicles.Technology is proving to be a critical enabler in this rapidly evolving landscape. Standard Chartered's ViTAL platform leverages DLT/blockchain technology to enhance fund processing, while sophisticated data analytics tools improve regulatory compliance and performance measurement. These technological innovations are particularly crucial for private market investments, which typically require specialized infrastructure for administration, valuation, and investor reporting.For fund managers navigating this complex environment, independent Management Companies (ManCos) have emerged as strategic partners, offering regulatory expertise, operational efficiency, and accelerated market access. Their role is increasingly vital as the industry embraces more sophisticated fund structures and ESG-focused investment strategies.Industry research suggests UAE retail investors represent a $100 billion opportunity for private market and ESG investments, highlighting the significant growth potential in these segments. The SCA's growing list of passported funds—including specialized vehicles focused on pre-IPO technology companies, renewable energy infrastructure, and real estate opportunities—demonstrates the increasing sophistication available to UAE investors.The transformation of the UAE's fund industry represents more than regulatory change—it signifies the emergence of a mature, sophisticated market aligned with global best practices while maintaining its unique regional character. How is your organization adapting to these transformative changes in the UAE's fund landscape? 📢 Understanding Dubai’s Property Payment Plans: Which One Suits You? 🏗️💰Understanding payment plans can make a big difference in your investment strategy.  Let’s break down the two most common options:🔹 Standard Payment Plan (Construction-Linked)Payments are made in installments as construction progresses.Typically requires 20%-30% down payment upfront.Remaining payments are spread over 2-4 years.✅ Pros: ✔️ Less financial commitment at the start. ✔️ Payments align with project progress, reducing risk. ✔️ More options available from top developers like Emaar, Meraas, and Sobha.❌ Cons: ⏳ You don’t take ownership until handover. 💰 Final balloon payment can be significant.🔹 Post-Handover Payment PlanPay a portion (e.g., 40%-50%) during construction.Remaining balance is paid after handover (spread over 3-7 years).✅ Pros: ✔️ Immediate property ownership & potential rental income. ✔️ Less financial strain as payments are extended. ✔️ Offered by developers like Ellington, Danube, and Azizi.❌ Cons: 📈 Prices may be slightly higher than standard plans. 🏦 Long-term financial commitment.📊 Which Plan is Right for You? ✅ If you prefer lower upfront costs, go for a standard plan. ✅ If you want immediate rental income or flexibility, a post-handover plan might work better.💡 Smart investors weigh their options carefully. Which plan would you choose?hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#RealEstateTips hashtag#InvestmentStrategy hashtag#WealthBuilding hashtag#UAEProperty

Post Content:
Dubai's 2040 Vision focuses on urban development and sustainability, the D33 Agenda is centered on economic growth and global competitiveness. Together, they form a holistic vision for Dubai's future. With questions about supply vs demand in the real estate market I thought it be useful to share key elements of the two.Scope and Focus:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: This is a comprehensive urban planning framework that focuses on the physical and spatial development of Dubai. It outlines strategies for land use, infrastructure, transportation, sustainability, and the allocation of resources to ensure balanced growth across the city. The plan emphasizes creating a sustainable, inclusive, and resilient urban environment.- D33 Strategy: This is an economic strategy aimed at boosting Dubai's global competitiveness and economic growth for the period 2023 - 2033. It focuses on key sectors such as trade, tourism, technology, and innovation, with the goal of doubling the size of Dubai's economy and solidifying its position as a leading global hub.Timeframe:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: As the name suggests, this plan looks ahead to 2040, providing a long-term vision for the city's urban development.- D33 Strategy: This strategy has a shorter-term horizon, targeting 2033, and is designed to accelerate economic growth and diversification within a decade.Key Objectives:1) Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040:- Enhance quality of life for residents and visitors.- Promote sustainable development and environmental conservation.- Optimize land use and infrastructure to accommodate population growth.- Develop vibrant communities and improve connectivity.2) D33 Strategy:- Double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033.- Strengthen Dubai's position as a global trade and tourism hub.- Foster innovation and attract foreign investment.- Create new economic opportunities and jobs.Implementation:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: Implemented through government agencies and urban planning authorities, focusing on zoning, infrastructure projects, and regulatory frameworks.- D33 Strategy: Driven by economic policies, public-private partnerships, and sector-specific initiatives to stimulate growth in targeted industries. ComplementarityThe two initiatives are interconnected. The Urban Master Plan 2040 provides the physical and infrastructural foundation needed to support the economic goals of the D33 Agenda. For example, improved transportation networks and sustainable urban development under the Master Plan will facilitate the economic activities envisioned in the D33 strategy.

*Eid al-Fitr; UAE announces holidays for public sector employees**Dubai:* The UAE government has announced that public sector workers will be granted three days of leave on the occasion of Eid al-Fitr. The Federal Authority for Government Human Resources has announced that employees will be granted paid leave in the first three days of the month of Shawwal. The exact start date of Shawwal is decided by the UAE’s Maspiravi Darshan Committee during the last days of Ramadan.Each month in the Hijri calendar lasts for 29 or 30 days. Since Ramadan started on March 1, Shawwal 1 will be on Sunday, March 30 or Monday, March 31.The Emirates Astronomical Society had previously said that Eid al-Fitr is likely to fall on March 31. If this is the case, employees will get a three-day public holiday. They will then have to return to work on Thursday, April 3.⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️ *Join the group for more news and updates from the expatriate world* 👇👇👇👇👇👇👇 https://lnkd.in/dix3up-h

However, financial institutions in the Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC) are exempt from this regulation.Under the new framework, companies must comply with federal and local laws, maintain separate financial records for mainland and free zone activities, and obtain additional permits if expanding beyond Dubai. The DET will issue and renew one-year licenses for businesses setting up branches in mainland Dubai and will soon release a list of permitted activities within six months.This initiative aligns with Dubai’s D33 agenda, which aims to double the city's economy to AED 32 trillion ($8.71 trillion) over the next decade, positioning Dubai among the top three global cities. The agenda also seeks to foster 30 unicorn startups, boost economic diversification, and strengthen Dubai’s status as a leading digital economy hub.With this resolution, Dubai reinforces its commitment to business-friendly policies, making it easier for companies to scale and thrive in one of the world’s fastest-growing economies.hashtag#freezonebusiness hashtag#businessexpansion hashtag#dubai hashtag#d33agenda

Free Zone Companies Can Now Operate Anywhere in the EmirateDubai has introduced a game-changing regulation that allows free zone companies to operate outside their designated zones, opening up new opportunities for business expansion and growth. This resolution was issued by Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed, Crown Prince of Dubai, Deputy Prime Minister, and Minister of Defence, in his role as Chairman of the Executive Council of Dubai. Key Highlights:✅ Expand Beyond Free Zones – Businesses can now serve clients across Dubai, not just within their designated areas. ✅ Regulatory Approval Required – Companies must obtain permits from Dubai’s Department of Economy and Tourism (DET) and comply with all applicable laws. ✅ Financial Transparency – Businesses need to keep separate financial records for operations outside their free zone. Is Dubai Real Estate Market booming at a spectacular pace? 🏙️ They say it’s breaking record every month. With more investors looking to purchase the right property, how do you think one should choose?Here are few important tips that I usually share with my buyers while purchasing a residential property in Dubai:▪️ Investment Criteria:Firstly, make sure you’re aware of what your requirements, expectations and priorities are.For an investor this can either be rental returns or capital appreciation.But an end user might be looking for a better neighbourhood, conveyance to their workplace, schools etc.▪️ Price:Draft an exact idea about the amount of money you want to invest in a property. One must have enough liquidity to cover all the payment plans.▪️ Location:Finding the best location simply becomes on of the most important factors of a purchase. Buyers must be aware of infrastructure developments going to happen in the location where they are looking to purchase. They should analyze the current supply and demand of properties as well as create an estimate of the future supply inflows in that particular locality. An investor should be aware of the price per sqft of the properties in the locality and should have a better understanding of the appreciation value in the future by analyzing the infrastructure developments and government initiatives to happen in the future.For an end user conveyance to meet daily needs such as the distance from the office, school for their children etc., along with a neighbourhood that provides you a space of comfort and peaceful living could be the primary preference.▪️ Payment Plan:While selecting an off-plan property, the buyer should be aware of the payment plans provided by the developer.These payment plans are scheduled over the construction period and it should be convenient in accordance with the liquidity of the buyer. Different developers offer different sort of payment plans according to the project and their demand.▪️ Developer:Last but not least, the Developer’s profile is one of the most crucial aspects to consider while purchasing a property.The buyer should be aware of the track record of the developer such as the previous completed projects, construction timeline of the previous projects, quality of the buildings from previous projects, and whether they have an escrow account for the transfer of money.Given above are simply a few details one should consider before making an investment in real estate. There are definitely a lot other things to consider too, and this is where a property consultant comes into play.Share your thoughts!Looking to invest in this booming market? Contact me for expert guidance!

Some big news today!!​Dubai has introduced Executive Council Resolution No. (11) of 2025, issued by HH Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum , Crown Prince of Dubai and Chairman of The General Secretariat Of The Executive Council - Government of Dubai , to regulate the operations of free zone establishments wishing to operate outside their designated zones within the emirate. ​⁣⁣Key aspects of the resolution include:⁣⁣Licensing Requirements: Free zone companies seeking to operate in mainland Dubai must obtain the necessary licenses or permits from the Dubai Department of Economy and Tourism (DET). ​⁣⁣Compliance: Establishments are required to adhere to all applicable federal and local regulations related to their activities and maintain separate financial records for operations conducted outside the free zone. ​⁣DET's Authority: The DET is authorized to grant permissions for free zone establishments to operate in mainland Dubai by issuing licenses for establishing branches within the emirate or for branches headquartered in the free zone. These licenses are valid for one year and can be renewed. ​⁣⁣⁣This resolution aligns with the objectives of the Dubai Economic Agenda (D33),which aims to double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033 and solidify its status among the world's top three economic cities. ​⁣⁣⁣By facilitating the expansion of free zone businesses into mainland Dubai, the resolution seeks to enhance the emirate's business environment, promote economic activity, create jobs, and foster innovation, thereby reinforcing Dubai's position as a global hub for business, investment, and entrepreneurship. ​⁣Dubai getting more and more flexible !!

UAE's Fund Industry Transformation: How Feeder Funds Are Democratizing Private Market AccessThe UAE's fund industry is undergoing a profound transformation, driven by strategic regulatory reforms that are fundamentally reshaping how funds are structured, managed, and distributed to investors across the region.The DIFC and ADGM have emerged as essential facilitators in this evolution, fostering innovative investment solutions that align with the UAE's strategic vision of becoming a global financial hub.Global asset managers are responding through strategic partnerships with UAE-based entities, with companies like Standard Chartered, Franklin Templeton, BlackRock, and Aditum Investment Management pioneering feeder fund structures that maintain market access while ensuring regulatory compliance. Franklin Templeton's Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC)-domiciled fund ranges exemplify this approach, offering retail investors exposure to diverse asset classes through locally compliant vehicles.Technology is proving to be a critical enabler in this rapidly evolving landscape. Standard Chartered's ViTAL platform leverages DLT/blockchain technology to enhance fund processing, while sophisticated data analytics tools improve regulatory compliance and performance measurement. These technological innovations are particularly crucial for private market investments, which typically require specialized infrastructure for administration, valuation, and investor reporting.For fund managers navigating this complex environment, independent Management Companies (ManCos) have emerged as strategic partners, offering regulatory expertise, operational efficiency, and accelerated market access. Their role is increasingly vital as the industry embraces more sophisticated fund structures and ESG-focused investment strategies.Industry research suggests UAE retail investors represent a $100 billion opportunity for private market and ESG investments, highlighting the significant growth potential in these segments. The SCA's growing list of passported funds—including specialized vehicles focused on pre-IPO technology companies, renewable energy infrastructure, and real estate opportunities—demonstrates the increasing sophistication available to UAE investors.The transformation of the UAE's fund industry represents more than regulatory change—it signifies the emergence of a mature, sophisticated market aligned with global best practices while maintaining its unique regional character. How is your organization adapting to these transformative changes in the UAE's fund landscape? What opportunities do you see emerging from the expansion of private market access to a broader investor base?The full article is available at: https://lnkd.in/dh4nEqJaJean-Marc Laventure hashtag#PrivateMarkets hashtag#UAE hashtag#FeederFunds hashtag#Funds hashtag#GCC hashtag#Dubai hashtag#AbuDhabi hashtag#UK

Let’s break down the two most common options:🔹 Standard Payment Plan (Construction-Linked)Payments are made in installments as construction progresses.Typically requires 20%-30% down payment upfront.Remaining payments are spread over 2-4 years.✅ Pros: ✔️ Less financial commitment at the start. ✔️ Payments align with project progress, reducing risk. ✔️ More options available from top developers like Emaar, Meraas, and Sobha.❌ Cons: ⏳ You don’t take ownership until handover. 💰 Final balloon payment can be significant.🔹 Post-Handover Payment PlanPay a portion (e.g., 40%-50%) during construction.Remaining balance is paid after handover (spread over 3-7 years).✅ Pros: ✔️ Immediate property ownership & potential rental income. ✔️ Less financial strain as payments are extended. ✔️ Offered by developers like Ellington, Danube, and Azizi.❌ Cons: 📈 Prices may be slightly higher than standard plans. 🏦 Long-term financial commitment.📊 Which Plan is Right for You? ✅ If you prefer lower upfront costs, go for a standard plan. ✅ If you want immediate rental income or flexibility, a post-handover plan might work better.💡 Smart investors weigh their options carefully. Which plan would you choose?hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#RealEstateTips hashtag#InvestmentStrategy hashtag#WealthBuilding hashtag#UAEProperty

Username: Alexander O. P. BlomAlexander O. P. Blom
Post Content:
Dubai's 2040 Vision focuses on urban development and sustainability, the D33 Agenda is centered on economic growth and global competitiveness. Together, they form a holistic vision for Dubai's future. With questions about supply vs demand in the real estate market I thought it be useful to share key elements of the two.Scope and Focus:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: This is a comprehensive urban planning framework that focuses on the physical and spatial development of Dubai. It outlines strategies for land use, infrastructure, transportation, sustainability, and the allocation of resources to ensure balanced growth across the city. The plan emphasizes creating a sustainable, inclusive, and resilient urban environment.- D33 Strategy: This is an economic strategy aimed at boosting Dubai's global competitiveness and economic growth for the period 2023 - 2033. It focuses on key sectors such as trade, tourism, technology, and innovation, with the goal of doubling the size of Dubai's economy and solidifying its position as a leading global hub.Timeframe:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: As the name suggests, this plan looks ahead to 2040, providing a long-term vision for the city's urban development.- D33 Strategy: This strategy has a shorter-term horizon, targeting 2033, and is designed to accelerate economic growth and diversification within a decade.Key Objectives:1) Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040:- Enhance quality of life for residents and visitors.- Promote sustainable development and environmental conservation.- Optimize land use and infrastructure to accommodate population growth.- Develop vibrant communities and improve connectivity.2) D33 Strategy:- Double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033.- Strengthen Dubai's position as a global trade and tourism hub.- Foster innovation and attract foreign investment.- Create new economic opportunities and jobs.Implementation:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: Implemented through government agencies and urban planning authorities, focusing on zoning, infrastructure projects, and regulatory frameworks.- D33 Strategy: Driven by economic policies, public-private partnerships, and sector-specific initiatives to stimulate growth in targeted industries. ComplementarityThe two initiatives are interconnected. The Urban Master Plan 2040 provides the physical and infrastructural foundation needed to support the economic goals of the D33 Agenda. For example, improved transportation networks and sustainable urban development under the Master Plan will facilitate the economic activities envisioned in the D33 strategy.

*Eid al-Fitr; UAE announces holidays for public sector employees**Dubai:* The UAE government has announced that public sector workers will be granted three days of leave on the occasion of Eid al-Fitr. The Federal Authority for Government Human Resources has announced that employees will be granted paid leave in the first three days of the month of Shawwal. The exact start date of Shawwal is decided by the UAE’s Maspiravi Darshan Committee during the last days of Ramadan.Each month in the Hijri calendar lasts for 29 or 30 days. Since Ramadan started on March 1, Shawwal 1 will be on Sunday, March 30 or Monday, March 31.The Emirates Astronomical Society had previously said that Eid al-Fitr is likely to fall on March 31. If this is the case, employees will get a three-day public holiday. They will then have to return to work on Thursday, April 3.⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️ *Join the group for more news and updates from the expatriate world* 👇👇👇👇👇👇👇 https://lnkd.in/dix3up-h

This initiative, spearheaded by Crown Prince Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed, aims to bolster business expansion and optimize operations beyond the confines of designated free zones.Companies seeking to operate outside these zones must adhere to both federal and local regulations, alongside maintaining distinct financial records for activities conducted outside the free zone. 𝐃𝐮𝐛𝐚𝐢 𝐈𝐬𝐬𝐮𝐞𝐬 𝐍𝐞𝐰 𝐑𝐞𝐬𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐨 𝐄𝐚𝐬𝐞 𝐅𝐫𝐞𝐞 𝐙𝐨𝐧𝐞 𝐁𝐮𝐬𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬𝐬 𝐄𝐱𝐩𝐚𝐧𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧Dubai has introduced a new resolution regulating free zone company operations, making it easier for businesses to expand within the emirate.Issued by Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Bin Rashid, Crown Prince of Dubai and Chairman of the Executive Council, the resolution allows free zone companies to operate in mainland Dubai, provided they obtain the necessary permits from the Dubai Department of Economy and Tourism (DET). However, financial institutions in the Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC) are exempt from this regulation.Under the new framework, companies must comply with federal and local laws, maintain separate financial records for mainland and free zone activities, and obtain additional permits if expanding beyond Dubai. The DET will issue and renew one-year licenses for businesses setting up branches in mainland Dubai and will soon release a list of permitted activities within six months.This initiative aligns with Dubai’s D33 agenda, which aims to double the city's economy to AED 32 trillion ($8.71 trillion) over the next decade, positioning Dubai among the top three global cities. The agenda also seeks to foster 30 unicorn startups, boost economic diversification, and strengthen Dubai’s status as a leading digital economy hub.With this resolution, Dubai reinforces its commitment to business-friendly policies, making it easier for companies to scale and thrive in one of the world’s fastest-growing economies.hashtag#freezonebusiness hashtag#businessexpansion hashtag#dubai hashtag#d33agenda

Is Dubai Real Estate Market booming at a spectacular pace? 🏙️ They say it’s breaking record every month. With more investors looking to purchase the right property, how do you think one should choose?Here are few important tips that I usually share with my buyers while purchasing a residential property in Dubai:▪️ Investment Criteria:Firstly, make sure you’re aware of what your requirements, expectations and priorities are.For an investor this can either be rental returns or capital appreciation.But an end user might be looking for a better neighbourhood, conveyance to their workplace, schools etc.▪️ Price:Draft an exact idea about the amount of money you want to invest in a property. One must have enough liquidity to cover all the payment plans.▪️ Location:Finding the best location simply becomes on of the most important factors of a purchase. Buyers must be aware of infrastructure developments going to happen in the location where they are looking to purchase. They should analyze the current supply and demand of properties as well as create an estimate of the future supply inflows in that particular locality. An investor should be aware of the price per sqft of the properties in the locality and should have a better understanding of the appreciation value in the future by analyzing the infrastructure developments and government initiatives to happen in the future.For an end user conveyance to meet daily needs such as the distance from the office, school for their children etc., along with a neighbourhood that provides you a space of comfort and peaceful living could be the primary preference.▪️ Payment Plan:While selecting an off-plan property, the buyer should be aware of the payment plans provided by the developer.These payment plans are scheduled over the construction period and it should be convenient in accordance with the liquidity of the buyer. Different developers offer different sort of payment plans according to the project and their demand.▪️ Developer:Last but not least, the Developer’s profile is one of the most crucial aspects to consider while purchasing a property.The buyer should be aware of the track record of the developer such as the previous completed projects, construction timeline of the previous projects, quality of the buildings from previous projects, and whether they have an escrow account for the transfer of money.Given above are simply a few details one should consider before making an investment in real estate. There are definitely a lot other things to consider too, and this is where a property consultant comes into play.Share your thoughts!Looking to invest in this booming market? Contact me for expert guidance!

Some big news today!!​Dubai has introduced Executive Council Resolution No. (11) of 2025, issued by HH Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum , Crown Prince of Dubai and Chairman of The General Secretariat Of The Executive Council - Government of Dubai , to regulate the operations of free zone establishments wishing to operate outside their designated zones within the emirate. ​⁣⁣Key aspects of the resolution include:⁣⁣Licensing Requirements: Free zone companies seeking to operate in mainland Dubai must obtain the necessary licenses or permits from the Dubai Department of Economy and Tourism (DET). ​⁣⁣Compliance: Establishments are required to adhere to all applicable federal and local regulations related to their activities and maintain separate financial records for operations conducted outside the free zone. ​⁣DET's Authority: The DET is authorized to grant permissions for free zone establishments to operate in mainland Dubai by issuing licenses for establishing branches within the emirate or for branches headquartered in the free zone. These licenses are valid for one year and can be renewed. ​⁣⁣⁣This resolution aligns with the objectives of the Dubai Economic Agenda (D33),which aims to double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033 and solidify its status among the world's top three economic cities. ​⁣⁣⁣By facilitating the expansion of free zone businesses into mainland Dubai, the resolution seeks to enhance the emirate's business environment, promote economic activity, create jobs, and foster innovation, thereby reinforcing Dubai's position as a global hub for business, investment, and entrepreneurship. ​⁣Dubai getting more and more flexible !!

UAE's Fund Industry Transformation: How Feeder Funds Are Democratizing Private Market AccessThe UAE's fund industry is undergoing a profound transformation, driven by strategic regulatory reforms that are fundamentally reshaping how funds are structured, managed, and distributed to investors across the region.The DIFC and ADGM have emerged as essential facilitators in this evolution, fostering innovative investment solutions that align with the UAE's strategic vision of becoming a global financial hub.Global asset managers are responding through strategic partnerships with UAE-based entities, with companies like Standard Chartered, Franklin Templeton, BlackRock, and Aditum Investment Management pioneering feeder fund structures that maintain market access while ensuring regulatory compliance. Franklin Templeton's Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC)-domiciled fund ranges exemplify this approach, offering retail investors exposure to diverse asset classes through locally compliant vehicles.Technology is proving to be a critical enabler in this rapidly evolving landscape. Standard Chartered's ViTAL platform leverages DLT/blockchain technology to enhance fund processing, while sophisticated data analytics tools improve regulatory compliance and performance measurement. These technological innovations are particularly crucial for private market investments, which typically require specialized infrastructure for administration, valuation, and investor reporting.For fund managers navigating this complex environment, independent Management Companies (ManCos) have emerged as strategic partners, offering regulatory expertise, operational efficiency, and accelerated market access. Their role is increasingly vital as the industry embraces more sophisticated fund structures and ESG-focused investment strategies.Industry research suggests UAE retail investors represent a $100 billion opportunity for private market and ESG investments, highlighting the significant growth potential in these segments. The SCA's growing list of passported funds—including specialized vehicles focused on pre-IPO technology companies, renewable energy infrastructure, and real estate opportunities—demonstrates the increasing sophistication available to UAE investors.The transformation of the UAE's fund industry represents more than regulatory change—it signifies the emergence of a mature, sophisticated market aligned with global best practices while maintaining its unique regional character. How is your organization adapting to these transformative changes in the UAE's fund landscape? What opportunities do you see emerging from the expansion of private market access to a broader investor base?The full article is available at: https://lnkd.in/dh4nEqJaJean-Marc Laventure hashtag#PrivateMarkets hashtag#UAE hashtag#FeederFunds hashtag#Funds hashtag#GCC hashtag#Dubai hashtag#AbuDhabi hashtag#UK

📢 Understanding Dubai’s Property Payment Plans: Which One Suits You? 🏗️💰Understanding payment plans can make a big difference in your investment strategy.  Let’s break down the two most common options:🔹 Standard Payment Plan (Construction-Linked)Payments are made in installments as construction progresses.Typically requires 20%-30% down payment upfront.Remaining payments are spread over 2-4 years.✅ Pros: ✔️ Less financial commitment at the start. ✔️ Payments align with project progress, reducing risk. ✔️ More options available from top developers like Emaar, Meraas, and Sobha.❌ Cons: ⏳ You don’t take ownership until handover. 💰 Final balloon payment can be significant.🔹 Post-Handover Payment PlanPay a portion (e.g., 40%-50%) during construction.Remaining balance is paid after handover (spread over 3-7 years).✅ Pros: ✔️ Immediate property ownership & potential rental income. ✔️ Less financial strain as payments are extended. ✔️ Offered by developers like Ellington, Danube, and Azizi.❌ Cons: 📈 Prices may be slightly higher than standard plans. 🏦 Long-term financial commitment.📊 Which Plan is Right for You? ✅ If you prefer lower upfront costs, go for a standard plan. ✅ If you want immediate rental income or flexibility, a post-handover plan might work better.💡 Smart investors weigh their options carefully. Which plan would you choose?hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#RealEstateTips hashtag#InvestmentStrategy hashtag#WealthBuilding hashtag#UAEProperty

Post Content:
Dubai's 2040 Vision focuses on urban development and sustainability, the D33 Agenda is centered on economic growth and global competitiveness. Together, they form a holistic vision for Dubai's future. With questions about supply vs demand in the real estate market I thought it be useful to share key elements of the two.Scope and Focus:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: This is a comprehensive urban planning framework that focuses on the physical and spatial development of Dubai. It outlines strategies for land use, infrastructure, transportation, sustainability, and the allocation of resources to ensure balanced growth across the city. The plan emphasizes creating a sustainable, inclusive, and resilient urban environment.- D33 Strategy: This is an economic strategy aimed at boosting Dubai's global competitiveness and economic growth for the period 2023 - 2033. It focuses on key sectors such as trade, tourism, technology, and innovation, with the goal of doubling the size of Dubai's economy and solidifying its position as a leading global hub.Timeframe:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: As the name suggests, this plan looks ahead to 2040, providing a long-term vision for the city's urban development.- D33 Strategy: This strategy has a shorter-term horizon, targeting 2033, and is designed to accelerate economic growth and diversification within a decade.Key Objectives:1) Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040:- Enhance quality of life for residents and visitors.- Promote sustainable development and environmental conservation.- Optimize land use and infrastructure to accommodate population growth.- Develop vibrant communities and improve connectivity.2) D33 Strategy:- Double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033.- Strengthen Dubai's position as a global trade and tourism hub.- Foster innovation and attract foreign investment.- Create new economic opportunities and jobs.Implementation:- Dubai Urban Master Plan 2040: Implemented through government agencies and urban planning authorities, focusing on zoning, infrastructure projects, and regulatory frameworks.- D33 Strategy: Driven by economic policies, public-private partnerships, and sector-specific initiatives to stimulate growth in targeted industries. ComplementarityThe two initiatives are interconnected. The Urban Master Plan 2040 provides the physical and infrastructural foundation needed to support the economic goals of the D33 Agenda. For example, improved transportation networks and sustainable urban development under the Master Plan will facilitate the economic activities envisioned in the D33 strategy.

*Eid al-Fitr; UAE announces holidays for public sector employees**Dubai:* The UAE government has announced that public sector workers will be granted three days of leave on the occasion of Eid al-Fitr. The Federal Authority for Government Human Resources has announced that employees will be granted paid leave in the first three days of the month of Shawwal. The exact start date of Shawwal is decided by the UAE’s Maspiravi Darshan Committee during the last days of Ramadan.Each month in the Hijri calendar lasts for 29 or 30 days. Since Ramadan started on March 1, Shawwal 1 will be on Sunday, March 30 or Monday, March 31.The Emirates Astronomical Society had previously said that Eid al-Fitr is likely to fall on March 31. If this is the case, employees will get a three-day public holiday. They will then have to return to work on Thursday, April 3.⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️⭕️ *Join the group for more news and updates from the expatriate world* 👇👇👇👇👇👇👇 https://lnkd.in/dix3up-h

𝐃𝐮𝐛𝐚𝐢 𝐈𝐬𝐬𝐮𝐞𝐬 𝐍𝐞𝐰 𝐑𝐞𝐬𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐨 𝐄𝐚𝐬𝐞 𝐅𝐫𝐞𝐞 𝐙𝐨𝐧𝐞 𝐁𝐮𝐬𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬𝐬 𝐄𝐱𝐩𝐚𝐧𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧Dubai has introduced a new resolution regulating free zone company operations, making it easier for businesses to expand within the emirate.Issued by Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Bin Rashid, Crown Prince of Dubai and Chairman of the Executive Council, the resolution allows free zone companies to operate in mainland Dubai, provided they obtain the necessary permits from the Dubai Department of Economy and Tourism (DET). However, financial institutions in the Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC) are exempt from this regulation.Under the new framework, companies must comply with federal and local laws, maintain separate financial records for mainland and free zone activities, and obtain additional permits if expanding beyond Dubai. The DET will issue and renew one-year licenses for businesses setting up branches in mainland Dubai and will soon release a list of permitted activities within six months.This initiative aligns with Dubai’s D33 agenda, which aims to double the city's economy to AED 32 trillion ($8.71 trillion) over the next decade, positioning Dubai among the top three global cities. The agenda also seeks to foster 30 unicorn startups, boost economic diversification, and strengthen Dubai’s status as a leading digital economy hub.With this resolution, Dubai reinforces its commitment to business-friendly policies, making it easier for companies to scale and thrive in one of the world’s fastest-growing economies.hashtag#freezonebusiness hashtag#businessexpansion hashtag#dubai hashtag#d33agenda

Is Dubai Real Estate Market booming at a spectacular pace? 🏙️ They say it’s breaking record every month. With more investors looking to purchase the right property, how do you think one should choose?Here are few important tips that I usually share with my buyers while purchasing a residential property in Dubai:▪️ Investment Criteria:Firstly, make sure you’re aware of what your requirements, expectations and priorities are.For an investor this can either be rental returns or capital appreciation.But an end user might be looking for a better neighbourhood, conveyance to their workplace, schools etc.▪️ Price:Draft an exact idea about the amount of money you want to invest in a property. One must have enough liquidity to cover all the payment plans.▪️ Location:Finding the best location simply becomes on of the most important factors of a purchase. Buyers must be aware of infrastructure developments going to happen in the location where they are looking to purchase. They should analyze the current supply and demand of properties as well as create an estimate of the future supply inflows in that particular locality. An investor should be aware of the price per sqft of the properties in the locality and should have a better understanding of the appreciation value in the future by analyzing the infrastructure developments and government initiatives to happen in the future.For an end user conveyance to meet daily needs such as the distance from the office, school for their children etc., along with a neighbourhood that provides you a space of comfort and peaceful living could be the primary preference.▪️ Payment Plan:While selecting an off-plan property, the buyer should be aware of the payment plans provided by the developer.These payment plans are scheduled over the construction period and it should be convenient in accordance with the liquidity of the buyer. Different developers offer different sort of payment plans according to the project and their demand.▪️ Developer:Last but not least, the Developer’s profile is one of the most crucial aspects to consider while purchasing a property.The buyer should be aware of the track record of the developer such as the previous completed projects, construction timeline of the previous projects, quality of the buildings from previous projects, and whether they have an escrow account for the transfer of money.Given above are simply a few details one should consider before making an investment in real estate. There are definitely a lot other things to consider too, and this is where a property consultant comes into play.Share your thoughts!Looking to invest in this booming market? Contact me for expert guidance!

Some big news today!!​Dubai has introduced Executive Council Resolution No. (11) of 2025, issued by HH Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum , Crown Prince of Dubai and Chairman of The General Secretariat Of The Executive Council - Government of Dubai , to regulate the operations of free zone establishments wishing to operate outside their designated zones within the emirate. ​⁣⁣Key aspects of the resolution include:⁣⁣Licensing Requirements: Free zone companies seeking to operate in mainland Dubai must obtain the necessary licenses or permits from the Dubai Department of Economy and Tourism (DET). ​⁣⁣Compliance: Establishments are required to adhere to all applicable federal and local regulations related to their activities and maintain separate financial records for operations conducted outside the free zone. ​⁣DET's Authority: The DET is authorized to grant permissions for free zone establishments to operate in mainland Dubai by issuing licenses for establishing branches within the emirate or for branches headquartered in the free zone. These licenses are valid for one year and can be renewed. ​⁣⁣⁣This resolution aligns with the objectives of the Dubai Economic Agenda (D33),which aims to double the size of Dubai's economy by 2033 and solidify its status among the world's top three economic cities. ​⁣⁣⁣By facilitating the expansion of free zone businesses into mainland Dubai, the resolution seeks to enhance the emirate's business environment, promote economic activity, create jobs, and foster innovation, thereby reinforcing Dubai's position as a global hub for business, investment, and entrepreneurship. ​⁣Dubai getting more and more flexible !!

UAE's Fund Industry Transformation: How Feeder Funds Are Democratizing Private Market AccessThe UAE's fund industry is undergoing a profound transformation, driven by strategic regulatory reforms that are fundamentally reshaping how funds are structured, managed, and distributed to investors across the region.The DIFC and ADGM have emerged as essential facilitators in this evolution, fostering innovative investment solutions that align with the UAE's strategic vision of becoming a global financial hub.Global asset managers are responding through strategic partnerships with UAE-based entities, with companies like Standard Chartered, Franklin Templeton, BlackRock, and Aditum Investment Management pioneering feeder fund structures that maintain market access while ensuring regulatory compliance. Franklin Templeton's Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC)-domiciled fund ranges exemplify this approach, offering retail investors exposure to diverse asset classes through locally compliant vehicles.Technology is proving to be a critical enabler in this rapidly evolving landscape. Standard Chartered's ViTAL platform leverages DLT/blockchain technology to enhance fund processing, while sophisticated data analytics tools improve regulatory compliance and performance measurement. These technological innovations are particularly crucial for private market investments, which typically require specialized infrastructure for administration, valuation, and investor reporting.For fund managers navigating this complex environment, independent Management Companies (ManCos) have emerged as strategic partners, offering regulatory expertise, operational efficiency, and accelerated market access. Their role is increasingly vital as the industry embraces more sophisticated fund structures and ESG-focused investment strategies.Industry research suggests UAE retail investors represent a $100 billion opportunity for private market and ESG investments, highlighting the significant growth potential in these segments. The SCA's growing list of passported funds—including specialized vehicles focused on pre-IPO technology companies, renewable energy infrastructure, and real estate opportunities—demonstrates the increasing sophistication available to UAE investors.The transformation of the UAE's fund industry represents more than regulatory change—it signifies the emergence of a mature, sophisticated market aligned with global best practices while maintaining its unique regional character. How is your organization adapting to these transformative changes in the UAE's fund landscape? 📢 Understanding Dubai’s Property Payment Plans: Which One Suits You? 🏗️💰Understanding payment plans can make a big difference in your investment strategy.  Let’s break down the two most common options:🔹 Standard Payment Plan (Construction-Linked)Payments are made in installments as construction progresses.Typically requires 20%-30% down payment upfront.Remaining payments are spread over 2-4 years.✅ Pros: ✔️ Less financial commitment at the start. ✔️ Payments align with project progress, reducing risk. ✔️ More options available from top developers like Emaar, Meraas, and Sobha.❌ Cons: ⏳ You don’t take ownership until handover. 💰 Final balloon payment can be significant.🔹 Post-Handover Payment PlanPay a portion (e.g., 40%-50%) during construction.Remaining balance is paid after handover (spread over 3-7 years).✅ Pros: ✔️ Immediate property ownership & potential rental income. ✔️ Less financial strain as payments are extended. ✔️ Offered by developers like Ellington, Danube, and Azizi.❌ Cons: 📈 Prices may be slightly higher than standard plans. 🏦 Long-term financial commitment.📊 Which Plan is Right for You? ✅ If you prefer lower upfront costs, go for a standard plan. ✅ If you want immediate rental income or flexibility, a post-handover plan might work better.💡 Smart investors weigh their options carefully. Which plan would you choose?hashtag#DubaiRealEstate hashtag#PropertyInvestment hashtag#RealEstateTips hashtag#InvestmentStrategy hashtag#WealthBuilding hashtag#UAEProperty

Dubai has once again redefined the global business landscape, setting a new precedent for economic leadership and innovation. In a historic move, HH Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum , HH Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum , Crown Prince of Dubai and Chairman of The Executive Council, has introduced a groundbreaking reform that will shatter barriers and reshape free zone business operations forever.A New Era of Business Without BordersFor years, Dubai’s free zones have attracted top-tier global enterprises with tax incentives, futuristic infrastructure, and streamlined regulations. However, companies were constrained—confined to specific zones, unable to scale freely across the city.That limitation is now history. Dubai is removing the last obstacle to business expansion, enabling free zone companies to operate seamlessly citywide through a simplified licensing process. This bold reform tears down outdated restrictions, unleashing a future where businesses can scale, innovate, and compete without limits.The Driving Force Behind This Visionary ShiftThis strategic decision is a defining step in the Dubai Economic Agenda (D33), fueling a vision to:1. Double Dubai’s economy within a decade.2. Secure a position among the top three global economic powerhouses.3. Supercharge foreign investment and global trade by eliminating barriers to growth.By modernizing its economic framework, Dubai is not just evolving—it is revolutionizing the way businesses thrive, creating a city where scaling a company is as seamless as an idea taking flight.How This Propels Dubai to Global Business Dominance1. Attracting Unparalleled Investment: The world’s most ambitious businesses can now enter Dubai with unrivaled ease, reinforcing its status as the ultimate investment powerhouse.2. Unleashing Limitless Expansion: Technology giants, logistics leaders, and manufacturing powerhouses can operate citywide, reaching new markets and forging strategic alliances.3. Accelerating Innovation & Economic Supremacy: By fostering a competitive, entrepreneur-driven economy, this policy fuels billion-dollar ideas, creates high-value jobs, and drives Dubai toward its D33 ambitions at record speed.4. Elevating Dubai as the Apex of Global Business: With this move, Dubai cements itself as the world’s most forward-thinking business capital—a city where success knows no limits.The Future is Now: Dubai’s Borderless Economy is HereThis isn’t just a policy shift—it’s an economic revolution. Dubai is forging an unstoppable, borderless business ecosystem, where companies don’t just operate—they scale, disrupt, and redefine entire industries.With this transformative vision, Dubai is the epicenter of global enterprise, a magnet for the boldest investors, and the launchpad for the world’s most game-changing businesses.This is the future of business. This is Dubai.
